alert.note: Alert for Clinton; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:21PM CST until further notice by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Illinois, including the following counties, in south central Illinois, Clinton, Marion and Washington. In southwest Illinois, Monroe and Saint Clair. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported 9 road closures due to flooded roads in Washington County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Belleville, O`Fallon, East St. Louis, Fairview Heights, Cahokia, Swansea, Centralia, Shiloh, Waterloo, Columbia, Salem, Mascoutah, Centreville, Breese, Lebanon, Freeburg, Caseyville, Washington Park, Dupo and Millstadt.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
